title: Honoring a Premade Teamate - Does it do NOTHING or just LESS?
body:
The honor FAQ says you can't game the system and honor the crap out of your duo partner to boost - makes sense. 

But, is it diminishing returns, or actually zero benefit.  Is honoring my duo parter (or a member of my premade 5) a completely wasted vote?  

Should I *never* honor them, or should I just honor them sparingly and favour match-made team mates?

Maybe if you honor your premade teammates too often they should grey-out to give them a break and indicate that you should pick someone else.

replies.body:
It's "less", not "nothing", as far as "honor XP" is concerned.

If you're level 3+, premades need TWO votes to get a flair for next game, whereas you need only ONE from a non-premade.

in riots FAQ post doesn't it say that premade will get zero benefit from honoring eachother? It seems like you wouldn't get less because then everyone would still only honor their duo... I thought in their post it actually said you will get less benefit yourself from only honoring your duo because it would be like you weren't honoring anyone which you need to do to progress. I don't think they meant that your duo gets just half the honor xp that would still be gaming the system......

It's probably not "half every time", because you would still only honor your Duo, indeed. But there are smarter ways to do that.

For instance, it can be full value the first time, 50% the second, 25% the third, 10% the fourth, nothing beyond that.

Of course, we don't know the real numbers, so the best and simplest solution is just to Honor your premades if you think they actually deserve it.

And about the FAQ, well, gimme a link ^^'

"That’s a great idea. Luckily, we’ve broken a few systems in our day, too. So we specifically built Honor so potential exploits like this give you (and your friend) literally no benefit. "    

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008474148-Honor-FAQ

Yeah, but it doesn't say that "honoring your premade" will get zero benefit, it says "potential exploits like this". I'm pretty sure that if you honestly and fairly honor your premades once in a while, they'll get something out of it.
"It's "less", not "nothing", as far as "honor XP" is concerned "   the original point of this was that it never went down to nothing. riots FAQ says "literally no benefit" aka nothing.
Literally no benefit **for trying to exploit the system**. Context, mate, context. You still get the "normal" benefit for honoring someone, even if that someone is your premade.

the question was if you got normal benefit if honoring them every time, "we specifically built Honor so potential exploits like this give you (and your friend) literally no benefit" idk what you are going on about it is obvious.  trying to exploit the system as in honoring a premade all the time... last time I'm commenting lol I'm sure you will keep going though because you want to think you and your duo are getting some kind of benefit.

No. The question from OP, to whom my first post was addressed, was "Doest it do NOTHING or jut LESS?" It's in the fucking title. And the answer to this is clearly "LESS", and **not** "NOTHING". The system is designed to prevent you from exploiting it, not to punish you and make you earn less Honor if you play in a Premade.

So let's make all this very simple: **Don't care about how the system is coded, and Honor your premade IF AND WHEN they deserve it, and it'll work.** Now, you can not believe me and never honor your premade at all. I don't care, it's your loss, not mine.

I don't have an exact source at hand, but it was repeated many times by Rioters when the Honor system was released back in the days, because as soon as the system was released, people wondered about that and asked about it a lot.

> [{quoted}](name=RadMedusa,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2GgEkc67,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-06-30T09:13:24.701+0000)
>
> Maybe if you honor your premade teammates too often they should grey-out to give them a break and indicate that you should pick someone else.

They want you to give honor to the players that deserved it the most on that match. If it's a premade, then honor them, if it's a random, then honor them. They won't make it it easier for you to game the system.
Not trynna game it - was just wondering if honoring a friend does less, or *nothing at all*.

In the old honor system I remember them saying honoring teamates was similar to honor trading and that you shouldn't honor teamates just enemies. U can't honor enemies now. I thought there was a comment bout occasionally honoring a friend who does well but can't remember perhaps its still out there in a search and perhaps it works the same way. I don't like though how they say everyone benefits if everyone honors. "A whole team gets a slight bonus to their honor level if every teammate votes. Just like the game, you win or lose as a team." Because it makes u honor every game 'to game the system' even though there will be games (especially in this community) where honoring someone just to get that team honor bonus will make u feel bad :P. like when ur the odd man out in a 4 man premade. Where ur fair game for whatever they consider 'fun'. withhold honor or get ur bonus and honor someone who doesn't deserve it.

I don't honor, because no one on my team ever deserves an honor. I do honor my duo partner because he complains about someone not honoring for the tiny team-wide honor boost. Doesn't matter to me that he gets nothing for it.
